#Text=Pawtucket
#Text=Pawtucket
#Text=is a Rhode Island city founded in 1671 .
#Text=It was home to the father of the American Industrial Revolution , Samuel Slater .
#Text=The construction of his historic textile mill , called Slater Mill , marked the beginning of said revolution in 1793 .

#Text=Since then Pawtucket has shifted out of textiles ( with only a few specialty manufacturers remaining ) and has grown to hold 300 diversified industries with the most prominent being jewelry , silverware , and metalworking .
#Text=Pawtucket has more than 71,000 residents ( as of the 2010 census ) .
#Text=It is a diverse city home to many cultures resulting in a spectrum of sights , sounds , and flavors .
#Text=Its neighborhoods have all improved greatly over the last decade as the city 's developmental policies focus on improving the quality of residential areas and expanding emplyoment .
#Text=With an emerging interest and concentration on the arts , Pawtucket has introduced performing arts and visual arts into the community .
#Text=By plane
#Text=T.F. Green Airport
#Text=( PVD ) is about a 20-minute drive from Pawtucket .
#Text=PVD is a national airport with connecting international flights .
#Text=Logan International Airport
#Text=( BOS ) is an hour away in Boston , Massachusetts and is an international airport .
#Text=By bus
#Text=RIPTA bus Route 99 , from Kennedy Plaza in Providence , converts into Route 76 which goes to Central Avenue and Newport Avenue .
#Text=It also converts to Route 71 to Broad Street .
#Text=By car
#Text=Route 95 runs right through Pawtucket .
#Text=Exit 29 ( from 95N ) will bring you to Central Avenue , from which you can easily get downtown .
#Text=By train
#Text=The Providence/Stoughton Rail line runs through Pawtucket .
#Text=The closest passenger train stop is the one in downtown Providence , about a 10 minute drive from Pawtucket .
#Text=Get around
#Text=RIPTA
#Text=lines run everyday all throughout the city .
#Text=The easiest way to get around Downtown Pawtucket is by bus , since traffic tends to make driving very frustrating .
#Text=Schedules can be found online at the RIPTA website .
#Text=If driving is your preferred means of transportation , traffic or not , beware of the one ways around the RIPTA Station and the Pawtucket Public Library .
#Text=Express Cab
#Text=See
#Text=Downtown Pawtucket has received federal recognition for its contributions to community planning , industry and architecture .
#Text=The Historic District has been added to the National Register of Historic Places by the National Park Service .
#Text=Pawtucket Red Sox at McCoy Stadium
#Text=( Pawsox ) , 1 Ben Mondor Way , ☏ +1 401-724-7300 .
#Text=Built in 1942 the Thomas P. McCoy Stadium is the home of the Triple-A Pawtucket Red Sox , a minor league affiliate of the Boston Red Sox .
#Text=McCoy Stadium was host to the longest game in baseball history , which lasted 33 innings played for 8 hours over the course of two days in 1981 .
#Text=After major renovations in 1999 , the ballpark is beautiful with it ’s hand-painted murals of past Pawsox turned baseball greats and left field berm .

#Text=Photo posters with biographies of players , information about the stadium , and the longest game , hung about the concourses and around the clubhouses make for a good reason as to why McCoy Stadium is one of the most visited minor league ballparks in the country .

#Text=At McCoy , fans enjoy promotional giveaways , such as “ bat night ” and “ bobble-head night ” and after choice games , especially on July 2nd , 3rd and 4th , get the opportunity to watch a fireworks display , which , packing the streets outside , draws citizens from all over Pawtucket .
#Text=Tickets for games are $ 10 for Box Seats and $ 6 for General Admission. .
#Text=The Pawtucket Redsox host concerts in conjunction with the Pawtucket Arts Festival , in which past acts included The Dropkick Murphys , The Counting Crows and Bob Dylan .
#Text=The show at McCoy kicks off the festival in July .
#Text=As the Triple-A affiliate of Boston , fans can watch Red Sox players rehabbing injuries with the Pawsox and view possible Red Sox athletes of the future .
#Text=Slater Memorial Park
#Text=, Entrances at Rt.15 Armistice Blvd. or Rt .
#Text=1A Newport Ave , ☏ +1 401-728-0500 ext 257 .
#Text=Park hours from Memorial Day until Labor Day are 8AM-9PM .
#Text=From Labor Day until Memorial Day 8AM-dusk. .

#Text=In the heart of the park is a small lake with ducks and swans , the Daggett House , the oldest house in Pawtucket , Daggett Farm , the Loof Carousel which opens in April and closes in , the oldest of its kind , and the Rhode Island Watercolor Society headquarters and Gallery .
#Text=Ten tennis courts , baseball diamonds , basketball courts and open fields allow for sport recreation all year round .
#Text=Picnic areas are available for rent and throughout the year , the City of Pawtucket holds Slater Park as a host for seasonal fun for the public .
#Text=Fall events are Pumpkins in the Park , a display of hundreds of carved and lighted jack-o-lanterns , and The Haunted Tunnel , which occur from late September until Halloween .
#Text=Winter Wonderland occurs in December , and includes the opening of the carousel for that special event , decorated Christmas trees , and concerts .

#Text=The Pawtucket Arts Festival holds concerts and other events in the park during the summer , the most popular being the free concert performed by The Boston Pops and a finale of fireworks , which acts as the closing to the festival
#Text=Slater Mill Historic Landmark
#Text=On the Blackstone River , a museum complex dedicated to the preservation and interpretation of the American industrial heritage at the birthplace of the American Industrial Revolution .
#Text=This serves as a Blackstone Valley National Corridor Visitor Center as well .
#Text=Slater Mill was the first water powered cotton mill in North America and was built in 1793 .
#Text=The Mill holds a number of events regularly , including workshops and ghost tours .
#Text=Tours are $ 9 for adults , $ 8 for seniors and $ 7 for children aged 7-12 .
#Text=St. Cecelia 's Church
#Text=, 1253 Newport Avenue , ☏ +1401 722-1101 .
#Text=At the corner of Newport and Central , it 's one of the biggest churches in Rhode Island .
#Text=Named after the patron saint of music .
#Text=Dagget Athletic Fields
#Text=, Dagget Ave. A wonderful athletic complex with a variety of field types and plenty of room .
#Text=The best slopes in Pawtucket for sledding/snowboarding .
#Text=There are woods in back , perfect for nice secluded walks .
#Text=The trail leads right into Slater Park , where it turns into a bike path , so bring some rollerblades or something .
#Text=Lee 's Pond
#Text=, Broadway , near Leedham Hardware .
#Text=A nice area and a skate park .
#Text=The main reason to go there ( only reason ) is because it 's the perfect place to go ice skating when it 's below freezing .
#Text=Loads of fun and chances are you 'll make a friend or two .
#Text=Hasbro Company
#Text=, Newport Ave.
#Text=The Hasbro company is one of the leading toy companies in the world .
#Text=Blackstone River
#Text=.
#Text=The Blackstone runs through Pawtucket and into Worcester , Ma .
#Text=Its power runs Slater Mill and , therefore , helped to began the nation 's transformation from farm to factory .
